title: Add TCP port check (nc) support
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add support for TCP port checks using netcat (nc) to verify if a specific port on a host is open and accepting connections.

The static_status project supports this via:
```
nc;8.8.8.8|DNS @ Google;53
```

This would allow monitoring services like:
- Database ports (MySQL 3306, PostgreSQL 5432)
- SMTP (25/587)
- Custom service ports

Implementation: Add a new 'tcp' check type that takes a host and port, using Go's net.Dial() to test connectivity.

title: Missing response body close in Ping.Status()
description:
File: status/check.go:52-61

Response body is not closed in Ping.Status(), causing a potential resource leak.

Fix: Add defer resp.Body.Close() after successful http.Get().
close_reason: Fixed in commit 2d189a9

title: Add alert/notification system
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add an alerting system to notify when services go down or recover.

The static_status project includes alert.sh supporting:
- Email (via mutt)
- SMS (via sipgate)
- Pushover notifications
- Custom notification scripts
- Configurable alert thresholds (notify after N seconds down)
- Recovery notifications (when service comes back up)
- De-duplication (don't spam with repeated alerts)

Implementation considerations:
- Create notification interface for extensibility
- Support webhook notifications (modern approach)
- Email via SMTP
- Slack/Discord webhooks
- Alert cooldown/throttling
- Store notification state to prevent duplicates

This is higher priority as alerting is essential for production monitoring.

title: Add traceroute check support
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add traceroute checks to verify if a specific hop appears in the network path.

The static_status project supports this for scenarios like verifying your primary ISP is being used vs a backup connection:
```
traceroute;192.168.211.1|DSL Internet;3
```

This checks if a specific IP appears within N hops.

Lower priority as this is a niche use case, but valuable for network monitoring scenarios.

title: Error wrapping should use fmt.Errorf with %w
description:
File: main.go:35,42

Errors should be wrapped with context using fmt.Errorf and %w verb for proper error chain support.

Fix: Use fmt.Errorf('context: %w', err) pattern.
close_reason: Improved error handling with proper context/wrapping using fmt.Errorf with %w verb. Removed unused errors import.

title: Code simplification: validStatus can be simplified
description:
File: status/check.go:128-133

The validStatus function can be simplified to a single return statement.

Current:
if code == http.StatusOK { return true }
return false

Simplified:
return code == http.StatusOK
close_reason: Simplified validStatus to single return statement

title: Ignored error from LoadConfiguration in main()
description:
File: main.go:74

Error returned by LoadConfiguration is ignored using blank identifier. Configuration failures will be silent.

Fix: Check the error and handle appropriately (log.Fatal or similar).
close_reason: Fixed: Proper error handling implemented. All tests pass with 79.4% coverage.

title: Add JSON API output endpoint
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add a JSON API endpoint for programmatic status access.

The static_status project generates a JSON file alongside HTML:
```json
[
  {
    "site": "https://example.com",
    "command": "curl",
    "status": "OK",
    "time_sec": "0",
    "updated": "2023-04-19 14:01:23 UTC"
  }
]
```

Benefits:
- Integration with other monitoring tools
- Custom dashboards
- Mobile apps
- Status aggregation
- Automated responses

Implementation: Add /api/status or /status.json endpoint returning structured data.

title: Add past incidents/history tracking
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Track and display past incidents on the status page.

The static_status project maintains:
- status_hostname_history.txt - Historical incident data
- 'Past Incidents' section on status page
- MY_MIN_DOWN_TIME - Only show incidents longer than N seconds

This provides:
- Transparency about past outages
- Historical context for recurring issues
- Accountability and trust building
- Incident duration tracking

Implementation:
1. Persist status changes to a history file/database
2. Track incident start time, end time, duration
3. Display recent incidents on status page
4. Consider SQLite or simple file-based storage

title: Migrate CI from Travis CI to GitHub Actions
close_reason: Migrated to GitHub Actions with Go 1.21/1.22 matrix, removed Travis CI config, updated README badge

title: Ignored error from json.Decode in LoadConfiguration
description:
File: main.go:61

Error returned by jsonParser.Decode(&config) is not checked. Malformed JSON will be silently ignored.

Fix: Check and return the error from Decode().
close_reason: Fixed: Proper error handling implemented. All tests pass with 79.4% coverage.

title: Implement reactive status page
close_reason: Implemented reactive status page with auto-refresh: added <meta http-equiv="refresh" content="30"> to templates/status.gohtml for 30-second auto-reload.

title: Ignored error from ioutil.ReadAll in Grep.Status()
description:
File: status/check.go:102

Read errors from ioutil.ReadAll are silently ignored. Network issues during body read will be masked.

Fix: Check and return the error from ReadAll().
close_reason: Fixed: Proper error handling implemented. All tests pass with 79.4% coverage.

title: Godoc comment improvements needed
description:
Multiple files need Godoc improvements:

1. main.go:19-21 - Multi-line comment could be single line
2. Multiple files - Comments missing periods (should be complete sentences)

Fix: Ensure all exported items have proper Godoc comments that are complete sentences ending with periods.
close_reason: Fixed Godoc comments in main.go, status/check.go, status/page.go: added periods, fixed grammar (return→returns, which→that), consolidated multi-line comments.

title: Tests make external network calls
description:
File: status/check_test.go:30-36,83-89,92-98

Tests make external network calls to real websites, making them:
- Flaky (network issues cause failures)
- Slow (real HTTP requests)
- Non-reproducible

Fix: Use httptest.NewServer for HTTP mocking as shown in AGENTS.md guidelines.
close_reason: Fixed in commit dad4d78: Replaced t.Fail() with descriptive t.Errorf(), replaced external network calls with httptest.NewServer mocks, improved table-driven test assertions

title: Iterate over and test each service from config
close_reason: Verified and tested service iteration logic. The main.go correctly iterates over all services from config.json using a for-range loop in CreateFactories() and in main(). The break-to-continue fix (service_status-w7z) ensures all services are tested even if some fail. Added comprehensive tests in main_test.go covering: table-driven tests for CreateFactories (empty, single, multiple, mixed, and unknown service types), iteration verification test confirming all services are processed, and LoadConfiguration tests. All CI checks pass (build, tests with race detector, vet, coverage at 78.8%).

title: Add custom script check support
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add support for running custom scripts/commands as health checks.

The static_status project supports this via:
```
script;/path/to/script.sh|Custom Text
script;/path/to/script.sh parameterA parameterB|Custom Text
```

Return codes:
- 0 = OK/Available
- 80 = Degraded (special status)
- Other = Failure/Down

This enables checking anything that can be scripted:
- Database queries
- API authentication tests
- Certificate expiration
- Disk space
- Custom business logic

Implementation: Add a 'script' check type that executes external commands and interprets return codes.

title: Critical Bug: Defer before error check in LoadConfiguration
description:
File: main.go:55-58

The defer configFile.Close() is called BEFORE checking if os.Open returned an error. This will cause a panic on file open failure since we'd be trying to close a nil file handle.

Fix: Move the defer after the error check.
close_reason: Fixed: Proper error handling implemented. All tests pass with 79.4% coverage.

title: Ignored error from tpl.ExecuteTemplate in Index handler
description:
File: status/page.go:27

Template execution errors will be silent. Users may see incomplete pages with no indication of the problem.

Fix: Check the error and return an HTTP 500 error or log appropriately.
close_reason: Fixed: Proper error handling implemented. All tests pass with 79.4% coverage.

title: Add maintenance mode support
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add maintenance mode to display a custom message and suppress error states.

The static_status project supports this via a maintenance text file:
- status_maintenance_text.txt
- If the file exists and has content, all errors are overwritten with maintenance message
- Displays a prominent banner on the status page

Use cases:
- Planned downtime for upgrades
- Scheduled maintenance windows
- Prevent alert spam during known outages

Implementation:
1. Add maintenance configuration option (file path or inline text)
2. Update template with maintenance banner styling
3. When maintenance mode active, don't report errors

title: Add ICMP ping check support
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add true ICMP ping support to check host reachability at the network level.

Currently our 'ping' check type actually performs an HTTP HEAD request, not a real ping. The static_status project supports actual ICMP ping via:
```
ping;8.8.8.8|Google DNS
```

Implementation options:
1. Use Go's x/net/icmp package for native ICMP (requires elevated privileges)
2. Shell out to system ping command
3. Use a third-party library like go-ping

This would allow monitoring basic network connectivity without requiring HTTP services.

title: Deprecated ioutil.ReadAll usage
description:
File: status/check.go:5,102

ioutil.ReadAll has been deprecated since Go 1.16. Should use io.ReadAll instead.

Fix: Replace ioutil.ReadAll with io.ReadAll and update imports.
close_reason: Replaced deprecated ioutil.ReadAll with io.ReadAll in status/check.go. Updated import from io/ioutil to io.

title: Add custom display names for services
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Allow custom display names instead of showing raw URLs.

The static_status project supports this via pipe separator:
```
ping;8.8.8.8|Google DNS
curl;http://www.heise.de/ping|www.heise.de
```

Benefits:
- User-friendly service names
- Hide internal URLs/IPs from public page
- Group related checks visually
- Better readability

Implementation:
1. Add 'name' or 'displayName' field to Service struct
2. Update config.json schema
3. Use display name in template if provided, fall back to URL

title: Test assertions could be more descriptive
description:
File: status/check_test.go (multiple locations)

Tests use t.Fail() without descriptive messages, making test failures harder to diagnose.

Fix: Use t.Errorf() with descriptive messages instead of t.Fail().
close_reason: Fixed in commit dad4d78: Replaced t.Fail() with descriptive t.Errorf(), replaced external network calls with httptest.NewServer mocks, improved table-driven test assertions

title: Factory and Grep receiver naming inconsistency
description:
File: status/check.go

Multiple receiver naming issues:
1. Lines 69,116 - Factory receivers should use short names
2. Lines 84,90 - Grep receiver uses 'p' instead of 'g' (confusing, copy-paste from Ping)

Fix: Use consistent short receiver names (f for factory, g for Grep, p for Ping).
close_reason: Fixed receiver naming: factory→f for PingFactory/GrepFactory, p→g for Grep methods. Updated all usages in method bodies.

title: Incorrect error message in CreateFactories for grep case
description:
File: main.go:42

Error message says 'failed to create ping object' but it's in the grep case. Copy-paste error.

Fix: Change message to 'failed to create grep object'.
close_reason: Fixed in commit 2d189a9

title: Add degraded status support
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Add support for a 'degraded' status in addition to up/down.

The static_status project supports three states:
- OK (green) - Service fully operational
- Degraded (orange/yellow) - Service partially working or slow
- Down (red) - Service unavailable

This allows for more nuanced status reporting:
- Script checks can return code 80 for degraded
- HTTP checks could consider slow responses as degraded
- Partial failures in distributed systems

Implementation:
1. Update Page struct to include Degraded map
2. Update template with yellow/orange styling
3. Update check interfaces to support degraded state

title: Tests could use table-driven pattern more consistently
description:
File: status/check_test.go

Some tests don't follow the table-driven pattern used elsewhere in the codebase.

Fix: Refactor tests to use consistent table-driven patterns as shown in AGENTS.md guidelines.
close_reason: Fixed in commit dad4d78: Replaced t.Fail() with descriptive t.Errorf(), replaced external network calls with httptest.NewServer mocks, improved table-driven test assertions

title: Typo in Godoc comment: responce should be response
description:
File: status/check.go:50

Typo: 'responce' should be 'response'.

Fix: Correct the spelling in the comment.
close_reason: Fixed typo: 'responce' → 'response' in status/check.go line 50

title: Logic bug: break instead of continue in main loop
description:
File: main.go:88

Using break instead of continue means only the first failing service is recorded; remaining services are not checked.

Fix: Change break to continue to check all services.
close_reason: Fixed in commit 2d189a9

title: Add SQLite persistent data storage
Ignored error from http.ListenAndServe
description:
File: main.go:103

Server startup failures will be silent. If the port is in use or binding fails, the program will exit without any indication of why.

Fix: Check the error and use log.Fatal() to report it.
close_reason: Fixed: Proper error handling implemented. All tests pass with 79.4% coverage.

title: Add SVG status icon generation
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Generate an SVG status icon that can be embedded in other pages.

The static_status project creates a status.svg file:
- Green if all services up
- Orange if degraded
- Red if any service down

Use cases:
- Embed status badge in README
- Add to navigation header
- Quick visual indicator without loading full page
- Include in external dashboards

Implementation:
1. Add /status.svg endpoint
2. Generate simple colored circle/badge SVG
3. Support color customization in config

title: Add response time tracking
description:
Inspired by Cyclenerd/static_status: Track and display response times for each check.

The static_status project tracks time_sec for each check:
```json
{"site": "...", "status": "OK", "time_sec": "0"}
```

There's also an open feature request (#9) to display latency on the page.

Benefits:
- Identify slow services before they fail
- Performance trending over time
- SLA compliance monitoring
- Degraded status based on response time thresholds

Implementation:
1. Measure request duration in each check type
2. Store response time alongside status
3. Display on status page (e.g., '✓ 45ms')
4. Optionally mark slow responses as degraded
